content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as the central storage depot.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-3.0, y=19.0) used for smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-4.0, y=21.0) processing copper ore into copper plates (copper-smelting furnace).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System)
Consists of the following entities:
- Lab at position (x=-7.5, y=18.5) configured for automation research.
- Boiler at position (x=-5.5, y=24.0) currently lacking fuel (status: NO_FUEL).
- Generator (Steam Engine) at position (x=-0.5, y=24.5) with connectivity issues (status: NOT_CONNECTED; previous energy ≈14958.33 observed but recent operations indicate connection problems).
- Offshore Pump at position (x=-7.5, y=25.5) operating normally.
- Electricity Group comprising:
   • Existing small electric poles at positions (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), and (x=-4.5, y=15.5)
   • New small electric pole at position (x=3.5, y=19.5) (successfully connected to the reference pole at (x=-0.5, y=19.5))
- Pipe Groups forming the fluid network:
   • PipeGroup with fluid_system=3824 at position (x=-10.5, y=16.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup with fluid_system=3825 at position (x=-12.5, y=18.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup with fluid_system=3827 at position (x=-8.5, y=20.5) – FULL_OUTPUT.
   • PipeGroup with fluid_system=3829 at position (x=-2.5, y=21.5) – EMPTY.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- AssemblingMachine1 at position (x=1.5, y=19.5) operating the copper-cable recipe; current warnings include “not receiving electricity” and “cannot create copper-cable due to missing resources: copper-plate (1)”.
- Output Chest at position (x=1.5, y=21.5) handling copper-cable dispatch.
- Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at position (x=-5.5, y=21.5) holding copper plates.
- Input Supply Chain comprising:
   • Wooden Chest at position (x=1.5, y=16.5) serving as the input container.
   • Burner Inserter at position (x=1.5, y=17.5) feeding copper plates into AssemblingMachine1.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fuel and Resource Management:
   - Before fueling furnaces, verify that sufficient coal is available in inventory to avoid insertion errors.
   - Confirm that copper plates have been produced and are present in the furnace before attempting extraction or insertion into the assembling machine.

• Entity Placement & Collision Issues:
   - Check that the target tile for placing entities (e.g., small electric poles) is free from obstructions to prevent collision errors.
   - Attempt resource insertions (such as copper plates into AssemblingMachine1) only when the resource is confirmed to be in inventory.

• Variable & Reference Management:
   - Define and initialize all variables (for example, ensuring that any reference like “new_pole2” is properly defined) before using them in connectivity operations.

• Power Connectivity:
   - Reassess the electrical network layout and ensure that all power connections (between poles, generators, and machines) are correctly established to resolve “not receiving electricity” warnings.

• Automatic Supply Chain Alignment:
   - Verify that the input chest and its adjacent burner inserter are accurately positioned and aligned so that copper plates transfer automatically to the assembling machine.

• Positioning & Proximity:
   - Ensure the player remains within the valid operational range (maximum placement distance) when executing placement or transfer actions to avoid range-related errors.
